awd_titl_txt: Electromagnetic Study of the Lithosphere and Asthenosphere  Beneath the Juan de Fuca Plate (EMSLAB) - Analysis of Data
awd_abstract_narration: This project continues the analysis of magnetic data from the              EMSLAB (Electromagnetic Study of the Lithosphere and Asthenosphere              Beneath the Juan de Fuca Plate) experiment.  Approximately 30% of               the Queen's data will be digitized using a new video digitizing                 system, the rest will be done when funds allow more work.  The                  data digitizing algorithm for the Univ. of Alberta data will be                 modified.  Egbert (Oregon State) will continue his analysis on the              Gough Reitzel array data.  The central transect of EMSLAB will be               inverted using the completed two-dimensional inversion program.                 All the EMSLAB data will be rerecorded onto compact disc which                  will allow wide dispersal and fairly permanent archiving of the                 data.  A special issue of the JGR (Journal of Geophysical                       Research) devoted to the EMSLAB results will be published.
